{{Pronounce|Edoras.mp3|Ardamir}}
'''Edoras''' was the capital of [[Rohan]] that held the Golden Hall of [[Meduseld]]. 

==History==
Rohan's first capital was at [[Aldburg]] in the [[Folde]]. Sometime after the battle of the [[Field of Celebrant]] (T.A. 2510), [[King of Rohan|King]] [[Eorl]] the Young, or possibly his son [[Brego|Brego,]] built Edoras. In T.A. 2569, Brego built [[Meduseld]], the Golden Hall.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2569, p. 1087</ref> on the top of the hill on which Edoras was built.  

[[Wulf]] son of [[Freca]] the [[Dunlendings|Dunlending]], invaded Rohan in {{TA|2758}} and took Edoras, usurping the throne in Meduseld.  But the [[Long Winter]], which had lasted five long months, ended and [[Fréaláf]] son of [[Hild]] came out of [[Dunharrow]] and with a small band of men, surprising Wulf, he attacked '''Edoras''' and slew Wulf, regaining the city.

It was here that [[Aragorn]], [[Gimli]], [[Legolas]], and [[Gandalf]] the White met with [[Théoden]].

==Geography==
The city was built on a hill in [[Harrowdale]], a valley of the [[White Mountains]] which lay under the great mountain [[Starkhorn]]. The river [[Snowbourn]] flowed past Edoras on its way west towards the [[Entwash]].

Edoras was encircled by a wall, with a dike dug around the hill. It had a spring whose water flowed in a channel along the main road.

Outside, there was the [[Barrowfield]], with the tombs of the [[Kings of Rohan|Rulers of Rohan]] arrayed in two rows by the time of the [[War of the Ring]]. [[Simbelmynë]] grew there. Through the two rows of the [[Barrowfield]], a rutted road led from the city gates passed the [[Snowbourn]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|id=LR 3.06.000}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name ''Edoras'' is said to mean "the courts" in the Mark-speech of Rohan.<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Edoras'', p. 247</ref>

In [[Old English]], ''edoras'' (plural of ''[[Wiktionary:eodor|edor, eodor]]'') means "dwellings, houses".<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 247</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Edoras.jpg|thumb|Edoras in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2001-03: [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]]'''
:Edoras is featured in the [[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers|second]] and the [[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King|third]] film. It was built on [[Mount Sunday]].

'''2012: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'''''
:Unlike many in-game settlements much smaller in size and prominence, Edoras is not considered a "capital" of its region. This is because early in the story Edoras is evacuated, with all inhabitants moving to [[Dunharrow]], and for the majority of the game Edoras sits empty. Instead, [[Aldburg]] functions as the "capital settlement" of the Western Rohan, hosting the hub for swift travel and various player facilities.
